benchmark_details.name: L2M3 (Large Language Model based Material Miner)
benchmark_details.overview: This research presents L2M3, a novel data mining system that automates the extraction and organization of Metal-Organic Framework (MOF) data from over 40,000 research articles into a structured format, enabling improved machine learning predictions in materials science.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a systematic approach for extracting and organizing Metal-Organic Framework data to enhance accuracy in machine learning studies.

data.source: Data collected from 41,681 journals on Metal-Organic Frameworks, integrating with the Cambridge Structural Database.
data.annotation: Data extraction conducted using advanced Large Language Models with human review.

methods: Automated data extraction using Large Language Models
Data integration with Cambridge Structural Database
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on evaluation of extracted information from sampled papers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in accurate data extraction and organization.
methodology.baseline_results: Outperformed previous studies with F1 scores higher than 0.95 across multiple categories.
methodology.validation: Validation performed by randomly selecting 150 papers to assess extraction accuracy.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data obtained with explicit approval from publishers to comply with their usage policies.
